primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God inaugurates His kingdom through the ministry of Jesus and the hidden signs of the church, moving from a state of ruin/despair to a state of eschatological joy.

tekstueel_bewijs: He will come and save you.
The glory of Lebanon shall be given to it.
Jesus refers John the Baptist to the great eighth-century prophet... the decisive event of salvation history is being described.

object.identificatie: Salvation / The Kingdom of God (The 'Glory of Lebanon')
tekstueel_bewijs: The time of God’s liberation is here.
The signs of the in-breaking kingdom of God are occurring.
That is the way that God planned it.

ontvanger.identificatie: The Church / The Poor / The Exiles
tekstueel_bewijs: The redeemed of the Lord shall return.
The poor have good news preached to them.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the 'ragged exiles' or the 'doubting John').

tekstueel_bewijs: The tiny signs enacted by the Christian community, are the pointers to the glory.
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; the Church acts as the instrumental Helper.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, Ruin, and Human Offense/Doubt
tekstueel_bewijs: The death knell of the old aeon has sounded.
Blessed is he who takes no offense at me.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is the 'old aeon' and the 'vast, miserable condition of the world,' requiring a divine Subject to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The church performing deeds of mercy (ESA food distribution) as a sign of the primary program.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / ESA Volunteers
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Tangible signs of the Kingdom (feeding the hungry)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly framed as a 'pointer' or 'sign' of the primary program (God's salvation).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Church → God/Jesus ← The Old Aeon/Doubt

voorbeelden_god_subject: He will come and save you.
The glory of Lebanon shall be given to it.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: The ESA group takes the food.

voorbeelden: I believe it must be said over and over.
We did not want or expect that kind of a Messiah.
John would instantly understand what he was saying.
Where does the strength... come from? It comes from God.
The Lord takes his power to himself.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's ability (Pouvoir) to save and the human inability to see or achieve this without divine revelation.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Lebanon ruined) to ~S1 (Hidden signs in Rye/Danbury) to S1 (Eschatological Glory).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's future 'crescendo' which is already 'secreted' in the present.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the ruin of Lebanon and the hunger in the Lower East Side are treated as real, heavy opposition.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It explicitly states 'God is doing it all' and frames human action only as a 'sign' of divine action.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The ESA group takes the food... it is a sign.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: In the Isaiah passage, it is God who is doing it all.
The death knell of the old aeon has sounded.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures like John are used as mirrors for the hearer's doubt, not as moral models to emulate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: John is the 'sentinel' who receives the news, not the hero who achieves it.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God provides the 'Pouvoir' (strength) for the 'feeble knees'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon perfectly integrates the historical reality of Lebanon, the biblical text, and the contemporary church through the lens of 'hidden signs'.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'vast misery' and the 'tiny signs'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The death knell of the old aeon has sounded.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by God as the primary Subject. Human actors are correctly positioned as Receivers or Helpers (sign-bearers).

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain this balance; it is the essence of a grace-oriented sermon.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Continue to emphasize that the 'strength' is given, not generated.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (ruin/despair) is already sufficiently heavy.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. It avoids the trap of turning the 'signs' into a new law, keeping the focus on God's agency.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Lebanon' metaphor, Greimas reveals that the 'engine' of the sermon is the Subject-switch from the parishioners' despair to God's action.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Isaiah 35; Greimas shows how the preacher 'casts' the modern congregation into the role of the 'ragged exiles'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'hiddenness' of the signs is a modal 'Savoir' (knowledge) issue—the signs are ambiguous to the world but clear to the 'Receiver' with eyes to see.

appendices.notities: The sermon follows Fleming Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace' almost perfectly.
